author: Andrew Jeong
title: A Stanley Cup Champion Goes Back to His Roots to Help Korean Hockey
text:
GANGNEUNG, South Korea—In 1991 and again in 1992, Jim Paek raised the Stanley Cup above his head as a member of the Pittsburgh Penguins, one of pro hockey’s most dominant lineups. 
As the coach of the South Korean men’s hockey team, his goals for the Pyeongchang Winter Games are more modest: Help his ragtag band of hockey players hold their own against some of the world’s strongest hockey programs on the Olympic stage.

Already,...
